text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is Cameron and I'm A Cloud
support engineer here at the AWS office
in Seattle
today I'm going to show you several ways
to redirect a domain in Amazon Route 53
to another domain
let's get started
no domain redirection using Alias C Name
Records doesn't alter the HTTP hostname
seen within the browser for HTTP based
website redirection or HTTP to https
redirection consider the Amazon simple
storage service Amazon cloudfront or
application load balancer Solutions
first let's look at redirecting with the
Route 53 DNS Alias record you can use
Route 53 DNS Alias records for specific
resources and Records within the same
domain as we'll see in later steps
navigate to the Route 53 console by
typing Route 53 into the search bar and
selecting the service
navigate to the hosted zones Link in the
left pane
select the hosted zone for your domain
name
here you can review your current records
in this case let's create an alias
record for a subdomain
www.myexample.com to the Apex domain
myexample.com
enter www into the record name toggle
the Alias switch
keep the route traffic to field as Alias
to another record in this hosted Zone
here you can see that you have a wide
variety of options to create Route 53
Alias records for given that they are
valid as specified by the Alias Target
API
for this example we're going to keep
things simple and just create an alias
to another record in the same hosted
Zone
the region should remain the same in
this case as well now select the Apex
record to redirect to
after confirming your desired routing
policy and health checks or adding any
other records select create records
finally confirm this by running a dig
command against your domain note that
this can sometimes take anywhere from a
few moments to several hours for DNS to
propagate
both the queries will resolve to the
same IP address which means that
www.myexample.com is pointed to the same
endpoint as myexample.com
now let's do the same with the cname
record there are a few considerations to
keep in mind when working with cname
records C names can't be used for Apex
domain redirects which means you can't
Point your root domain my example.com to
something like
www.myexample.com if you're using an
https endpoint be sure that the target
of your record supports an alternate
domain name if you're pointing one
domain to another using the cname such
as my example.com to test.com you might
need additional configurations on your
target endpoint to accept the
redirection again from your hosted Zone
select create record
enter your subdomain that you want to
redirect from
switch the record type to cname
for the value enter the subdomain that
you want to redirect to
after reviewing all other parameters
select create record
again let's verify by running a dig
command against your cname record
and now you know several ways to
redirect a domain in Route 53 to another
domain
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
foreign
